law.catch_line: Subject to the hearing provisions of § 5-312 of this subtitle, the Director may deny a registration...

section.section: If a person is charged with a violation of this title that could result in suspension or revocation of a registration or permit, the Director may seek an immediate restraining order in a circuit court in this State to prohibit the person from engaging in the operation of any cemetery, crematory, or burial goods business.

The restraining order is in effect until:
the court lifts the order; or
the charges are adjudicated or dismissed.

text.section:
If a person is charged with a violation of this title that could result in suspension or revocation of a registration or permit, the Director may petition a court to:
appoint a receiver or trustee to take charge of the assets and operate the business of the person in the event that the registration or permit is suspended or revoked; and
take any actions as are appropriate to protect the public interest.

Instead of or in addition to reprimanding a person, or suspending or revoking a registration or permit, the Director may impose a civil penalty:
not to exceed $5,000 for each violation of this title or an order of the Director under this title; and
not to exceed $500 for each day a violation continues past the time set for its correction.
Any civil penalties collected under this section shall be paid into the General Fund of the State.
